comments:
Windows XP SP1, on a Dell Latitute laptop 2.2GHz P4 with 1GB RAM, Eclipse 3.0
RC2.  (Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200406111814) I have received this error about
10 times over the past couple of weeks, while using Eclipse M9, RC1, and RC2. 
All I was doing, was editing a java source file and doing "Ctrl-X" to cut a
piece of code to move it to another location in the source file.  Also, (though
I don't have a stack trace) I've had other messages where it says "can't get
access to the clipboard, try again?" before.  In this case, clicking "yes" a
couple of times usually allows me to cut (or copy) the text in question. 

I don't have a reproducible test case.  I've tried to come up with one.  It
appears to happen randomly....  Sorry. :-(  Maybe the stack trace is of some use
to you.

Here is the stack trace I get in my log file today:
